review: Vascepa (icosapent):Heart doctor put me on it for high trig. and increased dosage to 4 a day. I no longer can ride in a car or hardly walk from the severe pain these pills have caused. I have regular feelings of gout, aching in both shoulders, and Afib. !!! I wouldn't wish this on my worse enemy. Didn't start out his way but sure has ended this way. Got to get in and figure something else out before something else gives out on my body.

Vascepa (icosapent):I really wasn't aware of the outrageous cost until my insurance briefly lapsed. It's $330 a month. For fish oil.  I almost felt bad for my health insurance co. Almost.  I've been taking this Gucci fish oil for two years and my cholesterol has barely budged. A little research seems to show only two studies that were paid for by Amerin that show good results in a very carefully selected group of people.  I'm done with Vascepa. It all sounds more like snake oil.

Vascepa (icosapent):I was put on this back in May. It's Sept, 2021 now, and I've been to the hospital twice in two weeks with Afib, heart palpitations, shortness of breath. This is the only new thing I been taking. I don't know if it's the culperate. It did its job as far as lowering my triglycerides.  I took 4 pills a day, and it went from 1145 to 615 from May-Sept.

Vascepa (icosapent):Taking this $100 a month medicine to lower very high triglycerides.  Not able to exercise effectively due to back pain from car crash. Also have high alt and AST from taking prednisone to shrink post radiation tumor. So very high triglycerides came down a some points into 300's after 4 months. So in January 2021, I had my gallbladder removed via laparoscopic procedure.  I kept taking Vascepa same dosage 2 pills with first meal and 2 pills with dinner.  Then I developed type II diabetes.  Now in September 2021, my triglycerides increased to 600's.  So I guess it does not work for everyone.  The cost may not be worth it for me.

Vascepa (icosapent):I took Vascepa at my Dr's request. I am awake now at 1AM because EVERY muscle and joint in my body ache. I can now barely function during the day the pain is so bad and I wake up in the middle of the night numerous times to use the bathroom. My knee joints now crackle every time I sit down. Right arm from elbow to wrist is swollen and I can no longer make a fist. I only took this medication for 6-8 weeks and had to stop because it felt like a cinderblock on my chest. I used to be able to take walks and ride a stationary bike. I can no longer do either. I am now doing a liver cleanse to try and get this stuff out of my body.  If I don't improve soon, I don't know how I will continue to function.

Vascepa (icosapent):I started on one gram Vacepa twice a day a week and a half ago. My Cholesterol is only 215, but my Triglycerides are over 750. Yesterday I started hurting all over in most of my muscles and joints, even my ear, eye, and bottom of one foot. My hip is in terrible pain, although it was hurting previously, but not this bad. I'm not taking Vacepa again. Terribly expensive even with insurance.

Vascepa (icosapent):Was on vescepa for 6 months. No side effects.  My triglycerides STAYED THE SAME and my LDL INCREASED by 100 and my HDL increased by 5.  No diet changes or exercise changes during the six months. So not worth it.

Vascepa (icosapent):Vascepa had no effect whatsoever on my triglycerides. Super expensive and not efficient. Nothing seems to work for me to lower my cholesterol or triglycerides. Everything else causes terrible side effects. This one didn't, but did nothing good either, except costing me an arm and a leg

Vascepa (icosapent):I have been trying many different drugs to lower my cholesterol and triglycerides.  I tried a small dose of Vascepa for 3 months with no side effects.  But there was no change in my triglyceride levels.   I was then bumped up to 2 grams twice a day.  After 35 days the side effects hit me.  Diarrhea, severe muscle pain in my legs, ribs and gout flared up.  This all started the cycle of side effects.  Now experiencing PVC's and dizziness and light headed.  Had to go to the ER for the PVC's.  Once I stopped the medication the side effects have diminished, PVC's are less frequent, but now I have the urge to pee every 5 minutes along with the dizziness.  I experienced just about every side effect possible on this drug.  I don't wish these side effects on anyone.  I hope the drug works for you.

Vascepa (icosapent):My triglyceride levels were consistently above 220.  After three months of Vascepa (4 grams/day), my triglyceride levels dropped to 62. The next test showed the levels at 67.  No noticeable side effects.

Vascepa (icosapent):Cardiologist prescribed generic Vascepa because I have high trigs and suffer real bad allergic reactions to all statins. Took the Vascepa for 2 weeks and experienced terrible muscular pains similar to that from statins (although doc says the two drugs don't work the same). Then discovered at several medical sites with authority  that Vacepa works when taken alongside special diet and exercise programs. Also takes 5 years to see any beneficial results equal to the original research numbers. So, waste of money and pain to swallow 4 "horse pills" daily especially if you are age 77 like me with probably only another 5 good years of life left before nature takes its course on the average human body.

Vascepa (icosapent):Noticed severe restless leg syndrome after starting Vascepa, something I never had before (other than when pregnant) and since this was the only new medication (I'm only on a blood pressure lowering drug otherwise) I knew it was from Vascepa. Also problems as others mentioned such as heart beating faster, severe gastrointestinal issues, joint pain and heart burn. Other issues I had were hair loss and my nails started to crack and virtually stop growing and my skin aged quickly. I tried Vascepa for around 9 months at half dose (2 a day instead of 4). I wonder how bad my situation would have been at full dose! Since stopping, virtually all symptoms went away, even nail issue. Hoping my hair will return. Would NOT recommend this drug. Also, did very little to lower triglycerides, only about 20 points.
Vascepa (icosapent):Average no 140/ 60, after a Vascepa 168/70 with 3 meds for hbp.

Vascepa (icosapent):Spend $3800 per month for Otezla to keep control of psoriasis and then take Vascepa and flush that $3800 as your psoriasis flares worse than ever. Great for triglycerides, real bad for psoriasis.

Vascepa (icosapent):Took Vascepa for 3 months.   Had blood work done before starting and after 3 months.   My triglycerides dropped 4 points.  It's not working so I'm going to stop it and save $200 a month.  No side effects.

Vascepa (icosapent):My Cardiologist put me on this after I had 3 stents put in. My recent bloodwork showed triglycerides in the high 200’s. In the two years I have taken Vascepa I have gained about 40 pounds. And NOW the muscle and joint pain. It was excruciating! It would wake me up at night - hips, ankles, shoulders - a different area every night. I had started at four a day - then I discovered it gave me terrible bad breath to the point people backed away from me. So I cut back to two at night. Two years on this med an in the beginning joint pain was never mentioned as a side effect, now they are mentioning it on the website. I stopped taking it 3 nights ago. The joint and muscle pain has almost completely subsided. I feel much better and have energy for the first time in a very long time.

Vascepa (icosapent):After 2 months of Vascepa 2 caps twice daily had an occurrence of gout which I didn't associate with Vascepa usage.  Also, developed a progressive problem with shortness of breath which started mildly which grew severe.  Decided to review Vascepa side effects since it was the only drug added to my normal regime of meds.   Appears "gouty arthritis" and SOB is listed as a patient side effect.  I've discontinued use.  The plasma 1/2 life of Vascepa is 89 hours so it remains in the blood extremely long and is not excreted thru the kidneys.  Vascepa may have helped my high triglycerides, I will never know since side effects outweigh possible benefits

Vascepa (icosapent):I was started on vascepa to help high triglycerides and to raise HDL.  Was not consistently taking them. Twice a day because they were big pills and one time I had a mild bad fish taste.  Had been on them for about 3 months and noticed heart irregularity, lightheaded for brief moments. Wore a monitor and it showed SVT, PAT,s and poss short bout of A-Fib .  Mentioned to my cardiologist that my newest med was vascepa but he did not think anything of it.  So. Two ER visits later, I looked vascepa up and saw that a small percentage of patients had these side effects.  I stopped taking them on my own and messaged my doctor that I stopped. I now am taking metoprolol small dose.  My question is. Will these heart symptoms go away or is this now a permanent problem.

Vascepa (icosapent):I have always had high triglycerides on annual physicals.  IMMEDIATELY lowered after taking Vascepa, without changing diet.  Have before and after blood tests.  I've been on for about 5 months with no side effects.  I also take 10mg atorvastatin, which I've been on for 15 years.

Vascepa (icosapent):My triglycerides were at 950!  My cholesterol numbers were unreadable due to my high triglyceride level.  I was placed on Vascepa and within a few months, the number dropped to 300 with little/no lifestyle changes. A few months later, with a few very small lifestyle adjustments, combined with Vascepa, brought my triglycerides down to 149. My cholesterol levels are in the healthy range, as well. I've had no side effects.

Vascepa (icosapent):After 4 months my cholesterol has lowered some, but my blood pressure average has dropped dramatically. I was averaging 150 over 90, and now I'm averaging 123 over 74? I have 5 stents, double by pass and have had heart failure, and a heart attack. I'm happy no side effects!

Vascepa (icosapent):I’ve only been on Vascepa for about two weeks.  My doctor put me on it for elevated cholesterol and triglycerides.  I have no idea how it’s impacted my blood levels because I haven’t had a blood test done since I’ve been in it but what I can say is I have experienced pretty much every GI side effect connected to this drug.  Started with terrible diarrhea and bloating and progressed too bad constipation and stomach pain.  On a positive note I have noticed an increase in energy levels and my mood is lifted but I stopped the medication today because the GI side effects are too much.

Vascepa (icosapent):I have critically high triglycerides of 2700 just started this along with crestor. I have been on it now for 2 weeks and I can say I feel amazing. I have bilateral osteonecrosis of the hips so this medication is not effecting me at all . I actually feel more energized , I have also made a diet change to a more organic vegetable food source . My triglycerides being high is actually hereditary for me ,not from poor diet as I don’t eat fried food or junk foods , I’m hoping that medication can bring my level down as Crestor alone brought it down from 3200 to 2700 .So far I’m very happy with the medication.My only complaint is the actual cost ,it’s way to high for most people to be on this medication.

Vascepa (icosapent):Have naturally high triglycerids at peaked at 650, my brother told me about this drug and I had my Dr put me on it. My bloodwork 1 month later came out 160. I had another test 3 months later and it was up to 180. Waiting for most recent test. No side effects

Vascepa (icosapent):I was taken off Lipitor and placed on 4 (2x a day) Vascepta. I know all the details in 3 of my bathrooms after getting up 4~5 X a night and have the 'urge to purge'. I felt like having a bowel movement, BUT, I just end up w/fissures. I I currently have a carbuncle on my butt. Nothing but liquid[s] come out for a few secs. and then [if it does] it's not 'firm'. I go back to bed and need to 'go again' 2 hrs. later. I have also 'lost it' before getting to the bathroom. Going back to Lipitor

Vascepa (icosapent):I took Vascepa for two and 1/2 weeks. I developed severe hip and leg pain. It got to the point that I couldn't put any weight on one leg. I stopped Vascepa immediately when I figured out that it was the culprit. I'm praying that those side effects go away quickly.

Vascepa (icosapent):After taking Vascepa or two months I have developed  side effects of severe bilateral hip pain, buttock and leg pain. Sometimes it’s so bad I feel like crying.  I stopped taking it about a week ago and the pain might be slightly better.  I’m hoping it will go back to normal. I’ll be discussing this with my Dr. in a couple of weeks.

Vascepa (icosapent):Was very excited to start this medication Vascepa due to high triglycerides.  The coupon for savings wouldn't work with two pharmacies, the company was saying their rates changed.  I couldn't control that or the terrible diarrhea and intestinal problems that followed.  If you can't leave the bathroom it's hard to work.  Maybe too much of a good thing.  I would not recommend this medication.

Vascepa (icosapent):After going on Vescepa for high triglycerides,  I noticed a change in weight, and my energy levels, for the better.I sweat a lot more than usual, but drank plenty of water, no sodas or junk food, and adequate amount of exercise. I lost 10 lbs and felt very conditioned.  Before I didn't have much energy but after taking these pills twice in the morning and twice in the afternoon and making a lifestyle change, I felt awesome.  My blood flow was great, and for me, this pill also worked as an anti inflammatory. I know meds react differently,  with different people, but I had great results, again , also with change of diet and exercise. That's the only way any med will work.
Vascepa (icosapent):Lowered triglycerides and plaque. No side effects.
Vascepa (icosapent):Vascepa Raised my wife's liver enzymes through the roof !

Vascepa (icosapent):I have been using this drug for over 4 months now (2 pills twice a day) and my triglycerides are still high and have not changed (they actually went up from 198 to 261) from before I began to use this drug.  For all the hype I would have expected it to at least have lowered my levels a bit.

Vascepa (icosapent):I'm an healthy young ( old ) man and after taking Vascepa nearly a year, my life changed. I was watching TV and there was an ad for Vascepa, I read the side effects JOINT PAIN. OMG, that was my problem. Since I had been on this for the whole 2 months I was having severe joint pains and did not know what that was. I try to avoid Doc visits. I have just stopped taking Vascepa and will talk to my Doctor.

Vascepa (icosapent):I was prescribed Vascepa for elevated triglycerides associated with HIV+. As I am on polypharmacy due to various unrelated conditions and many meds in my daily regimen duplicate, interact, enhance or all three, the many side effects associated, my physicians and I are hard-pressed to attribute the cause of most of my discomfort. Recently I  developed terrible ankle pain (bilaterally upon flexion). Another review contributor here voiced the identical issue along with foci of seemingly arbitrary intense deep muscle pain (for me, this is in the right quadricept). Stopping all meds and reintroducing them in turn is not an option for me. Additionally, MDs are no longer trained in full; rather, specialty is rife with the lack of scope that results. As I don't feel that Vascepa is of singular need for my life and health, I shall share my thoughts with my PCP and then wean myself off this med with care.

Vascepa (icosapent):I find that when my mother in law goes on Vascepa her memory takes a severe down turn.  I am in charge of her meds so I know exactly what she takes and when.  I know cholesterol has a roll in storing memories so I  guess this could make sense.

Vascepa (icosapent):Having a terrible family history of heart disease, mother died at 50 from MI, father first heart attack at 48. I've been on Vascepa 4 gm a day for almost nine months.  My most recent blood work showed a significant decrease in my triglycerides and LDL.  I've had no side effects. I've also experienced decrease in joint pain after exercising and a decrease in anxiety and increase in mood.

Vascepa (icosapent):I've been on the drug for a few days and noticed a big change, more trips to the bathroom (and some near miss) my sugars up, my weight up and changing all outings due to the fact that I may have an accident.  I started at 4 pills a day, 2 in morning 2 at dinner, then after the side effects I was told to just do one at breakfast. Thank goodness my husband can pee fast or use bathroom down stairs as I have had diarrhea all day.  I tried taking it at nite time,yeah that worked well -NOT!!! So stopped the crappy drug and today 8/6/2019, no problems.  I've been on Fenofibrate 145 for along time and have not had a problem.  I sending the Vascepa garbage back to the fishes and deal with my high tri's & cholestrol & sugars with out the problems Vescepa causes.
Vascepa (icosapent):30% reduction in three months. I have tried all other method for years with poor results. This works for me.

Vascepa (icosapent):AMAZING!! I've had high cholesterol and high tryg since age of 13. I've been on meds for years and never had normal levels until started Vascepa 1 year ago. Can't be more thankful with normal levels at age of 35 now

Vascepa (icosapent):I started Vascepa April 27th for high triglycerides. (441) After 3 weeks I started with horrible ankle pain in both ankles. I had been on vacation and attributed it to walking on the beach. It did not go away and after another couple of weeks I started with joint pain in both knees and flu like symptoms. I told my co-workers I felt like my legs weighed 100 lbs each. I could hardly make it through the day. On July 9th I started researching Vascepa as it was the only thing different in my meds. I even was scared I had something like Lupus or Fibromyalgia. Imagine my relief when I saw that the main side effect was joint pain!! I discontinued the Vacepa on July 9th and 10 days later my ankles and knees are pain free and I can sleep again!!! It doesn't affect everyone the same way but for me I'm finished with it!!

Vascepa (icosapent):Digger I feel the same way.  My legs feel like I have 20 pound weights on them and when I walk I feel like I want to fall forward.  Strange feeling.  We are monitoring me throughout the night to make sure it is just side effects from the meds.  Head stuffy feel like the flu almost.

Vascepa (icosapent):I’ve been taking a statin for years & my cholesterols & triglycerides were controlled. All of a sudden my triglycerides shot up. No one knows why. My Dr increased my statin dose by 30 % and put me on Vascepa. After 4 months of this very expensive medication my triglycerides went up even higher.Goodbye, Vascepa. Now I’ll have more money for vegetables.

Vascepa (icosapent):On Vascepa 1 month, Dr wanted to see if it lowered my LDL. However, my triglycerides are very normal (<100), so not sure if this is really the right drug for me. Too soon to say if any benefit.My only comment is on the price. The best I can do is $198 per month (4 gm/day). I am going to split Vascepa with a 1000mg  pure EPA product from GNC, at 1/3 the cost.

Vascepa (icosapent):I thought I was going to have another heart attack when I went to pick up my prescription and the pharmacist said $350. This drug is made only for the wealthy. Forget about duty and humanity this is just plain greed! I guess I will die an early death and my wife and daughter can collect the life insurance because I sure as hell can't afford Vascepa. It shouldn't cost more for medication than it did for my doctors appointment. It's time for the USA to regulate the price of prescriptions like every other civilized country does. I shouldn't have to take a trip to Mexico to be able to afford my much needed medication.

Vascepa (icosapent):Does not help. I was on Vascepa 1 gram, 2 pills x 2 times per day. I worked out 5x per week, ate very healthy, and triglycerides were getting higher while on Vascepa. I got better results while on OTC meds.
Vascepa (icosapent):The Vascepa has been very effective in lowing my triglycerides level, from 240 to 30, just in one month.

Vascepa (icosapent):Vascepa is not doing much for my  triglyceride  levels yet, but once I lower my sugar intake I think it will help. It has done wonders for my mental health. Less negative thoughts, better attitude. I do think it is causing some type of skin  condition. I am prone to a type of condition known as melei, not sure of spelling, it’s gotten so bad I’m going to stop the medicine for a while and see what happens. Otherwise I highly recommend it for slight depression.

Vascepa (icosapent):Vascepa gives me severe headaches. Very first time I took only for two days and then next three days I was taking Advil or Tylenol to reduce my pain. During this time I stopped taking the drug. Then after 4 days I started again and with in hours of taking nightly dose, I started headache again.

Vascepa (icosapent):Started causing bad leg pain and weakness in legs after about 3 weeks   Hip, knees and finger joint started aching bad. Got where I was stumbling and too weak to move. Quit 4 days ago and am getting better now.
Vascepa (icosapent):Used for 9 months.  No side effects.  Reduced my triglycerides to acceptable levels.  Also waiting to see my current A2 levels.  They were down when last tested 6 months ago.
Vascepa (icosapent):Was put on Vascepa for high triglycerides, it a good drug no aches and pains

Vascepa (icosapent):-  vascepa  will definitely give you some skin irritations and what looks like bites or sores.  After years of good results with taking ordinary Omega 3 I was forced to switch to Valcepa as a drug change by CVS Caremark,,,, bad judgement !!.  This one drug which the manufacturer put the doctors on their review listing and then had the balls to actually pay them to keep quiet.   Beware !!

Vascepa (icosapent):Started this drug 3 months ago for high trigs 323.Noticed increased mental acuity and a decrease in the pain in my damaged knuckle. Have not taken blood work yet.. So far so good...

Vascepa (icosapent):I have High trig, hypertension, high glucose and bicarbonate. Vascepa with Metformin seems to have dramatically reduced my bad numbers in the blood panels so that now they are  near to normal.  Additionally, the vascular performance of my lower extremities has improved dramatically.  I am not aware of any significant side effects

Vascepa (icosapent):4 years on Vascepa for arterial blockages and for just general cardiovascular benefit.  Research has proven it reduces heart attack and stroke by 25 per cent.  No side effects.  It is like taking a vitamin pill.  It also acts a little like an anti-depressant in that it improves your mood.  The best thing you can do for yourself if you have CV issues.

Vascepa (icosapent):Vascepa has kept my triglycerides in check for years.  Sometimes it might be borderline with diet, but overall, I'm usually in the safe zone.  No side effects and packaging presents so problems. No fish burp.  Great drug.

Vascepa (icosapent):I follow all things cardiovascular as my father and grandfather are gone from heart attack.  I'm 52 and saw the results of Vascepa announced and talked to my doctor.  My cholesterol is controlled by statin and my TG was about 170.  I've been on the drug 2 months and had no side effects.  In fact, I think it's working well.  In general my muscles feel better.  At the end of each day I ache in my muscles.  It's gone on so long I just took it as normal, and last week I told my wife, the craziest thing, I feel good.  As in no more aches at night.  Currently pay $194 a month off label
Vascepa (icosapent):This is awesome for me. Trigs are way down, memory is clearer. The memory thing is an unexpected added benefit.

Vascepa (icosapent):I have high Cholesterol, heart trouble (80% blockages). Best prescription med I've ever had to take, absolutely no bad side effects but several positive ones improved mood, no DES, some weight loss, reduced aches and pains , haven't experienced a bit of angina since I began taking it.

Vascepa (icosapent):I think this drug thins your blood. After I started taking it, I had constant bleeding on my sclera of the eye. I didn't realize it was the medicine at first until I looked up the side effects. My knees also hurt.

Vascepa (icosapent):I have never seen medication manufactured as poorly as this one. The capsules keep popping in the bottle, and the EPA oil gets all over everything. When I take the gelcaps out, I have to wipe the good one off one by one, then try to get the fishy smell off my hands -- which won't come off with just soap and water. Usually I have to rub white vinegar into my hands, and sometimes more than once. That smell turns my stomach -- it's like rancid fish. Moreover, Express Scripts won't take the medication back after 60 days -- even though they fill the prescription for 90 days. On top of all that, I don't think Vascepa has done my triglycerides much good. And that's not even taking into consideration all the side effects people describe here. I don't see how this is any better than a good fish oil supplement, which is only a fraction of the cost -- and I've never had fish oil gelcaps pop in the bottle. Going to ask my doctor to take me off this garbage next time I see him.

Vascepa (icosapent):I've been taking Vascepa for high Triglycerides for about 2 years now. After my first year, I had some joint pains in my left arm but didn't attribute it to Vascepa because I'd been on it for a year already. I spent about 2 month in physical therapy and am all better now, and am still currently on Vascepa. Amarin's website does say that joint pain is a side effect of Vascepa. My Triglyceridemia levels were at about 750 when I was prescribed, and now it's about 500 so I think that it has helped me lower my Trig level although I haven't had a blood test done in about 8 months so I'm not sure what it is currently but I'm told that I might need to take Vascepa indefinitely so that's that.  I am also taking phenophribrate but my doctor has said that Vascepa is a better option than phenophribrate because it's a natural fish oil but I have read that Vascepa is really bad for the environment though.
Vascepa (icosapent):I took Vascepa (1g) daily and noticed that my eyes were getting worse in eyesight after 1 week.  Then, my eye doctor said I might suffer blindness, so I stopped at week 4.

Vascepa (icosapent):Started with recommended dose of 2 Vascepa twice a day.  After about 4 months, the pain started in hip - couldn't even lay on that side.   To take daily walk needed support pole as pain would come suddenly.  Went off, cleared up.  Also ringing in ears increased and 8 lb weight gain.  Went off Vascepa - most side effects cleared up.  Tried half dose few months later.  All side effects--plus came back.  Never again!  I am a female in late 60's.

Vascepa (icosapent):Took Vascepa for 2 months, about to start 3rd month when I started to have flashes (floater type) in my eye to the extreme.  I also felt pressure  in my left eye. I went to my opthalmologist who told me the gel inside my eye was pushing forward and might cause tear to my retina. I was given another appointment in 7 days for a wait and see what happens.  If a tear occurred, he would have to laser the eye to save my retina and my sight. I don't have problems like this, I am healthy -I thought. What am I doing new that caused this or is causing this?  Vascepa...stopped taking it and 4 days later, noticed that the flashes were a lot less and no pressure to my eye. I have stopped taking Vascepa and started taking regular fish oil....

Vascepa (icosapent):Started with 1 gram twice daily. After week took 2 Gram twice daily. After 6 weeks triglycerides dropped from 950 to 625. Meantime my right eye was troubling me from macular degeneration. Got two treatments. Trouble reading. Also experienced right arm muscle pain weakness. Couldn’t  lift it straight out. After few weeks I stopped Vacepa. Eye got much better. Arm somewhat better. Still waiting for arm to resume normalcy. Possible my eye Vitamin added to problem.

Vascepa (icosapent):I started this drug on 4/13/2018 and within a week of being on it I became bloated, gassy and constipated. My skin is like an oil spill and I'm retaining water like a blow fish. I'm on a diuretic for hpyertension and retaining water only shoots my BP up. As much water as I drink throughout the day, I might go to the bathroom 3 times total. My muscles ache constantly with no relief of any of these side effects I stopped taking it as of yesterday. Statins I cannot take without the joint and muscle pains and literally not able to walk or go up/down stairs. My triglyscerids on April 5th were 257 and my total cholesterol was 211.

Vascepa (icosapent):I have been on Vascepa for about 18 months due to a lengthy medical history with deficits in Kidney, Heart, Lungs, pancreas, and connective tissue.   I've battled cholesterol and triglycerides and tried combinations of Lovasa and Statins- nothing worked.  I was prescribed Vascepa with Lipitor (10mg). Within six months I have huge improvements!  My numbers are only a few points from being normal again, along with improvements in my kidney function, eyesight, reduced systemic inflammation, which had caused four connective tissue tears.  I no longer suffer from excruciating body pain!  I have not had an asthma attack for over a year.  My A1c is 5.9 from a 7.6!  I feel healthier than I have felt in at least 10 years.  I just learned that my insurance company wants to discontinue paying for Vascepa.  My doctor is willing to help me fight this.  I call this medication my personal wonder drug!  I am not the best diabetic patient so I know the Vascepa is healing me from the inside out!

Vascepa (icosapent):When I started on Vascepa, my fasting triglyceride level was 1,170!! In 2 weeks they dropped to 261!!! My HDL cholesterol slightly improved from 20 to 28, total cholesterol dropped from 255 down to 166! My blood pressure also dropped from 160/110 to 130/82, this medication has also helped improve my vision at night, one thing I will note, this medication does thin your blood some, at least in my experience, but overall, I am completely side effect free, this product is expensive, costing me around $220 a coupon

Vascepa (icosapent):Insurance made me switch from Lovaza to Vascepa.  Lovaza effectively lower by blood triglycerides and increased my HDL.  Insurance co steps in and stated I should have been on Vascepa first as a step program.  Went on it and found out my triglycerides went up dramatically and HDL went down.  All the Beni fits of Lovaza went out the window.  Vascepa cost more than Lovaza marketed by Teva.  Vascepa contains only EPA.  Lovaza contains both EPA and D-HAWAII.Essentially Big Pharma put me at risk for coronary heart disease.  I am now on an older drug Lopid which for years has been shown to be effective in lowering triglycerides and increasing HDLs.  Also both Vascepa and Lovaza over time increase LDL, the bad cholesterol.  Bottom line is that both products can produce potential harm.I am a nutritional scientist who received NIH grants to study blood lipids.  Just a warning that patients need to be careful when there insurance company gets involved- it’s all about the money.

Vascepa (icosapent):I am 39 yrs old and have had triglyceride and cholesterol problems since my 20's. I tried multiple statins and experienced muscle pain side effects with them all. One year ago I was prescribed vescepa with lipitor (my 3rd try). I now have no side effects of lipitor and my triglycerides are much lower as well as my cholesterol. After about 6 months I started experiencing symptoms of low blood pressure. I have been on blood pressure medication for over 15 yrs due to high BP.
